page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area round{Netheravon, Fittleton, {and Figheldean}is owned almost exclusively by the Ministry of Defence. Within the parish boundaries there are two army establishments. { Fittleton-cum-Haxton,}like{Figheldean a mile or so down the{Avon,}has an old world look about it.{Netheravon}on the other hand has a more modern appearance with more recent development. The villages hug the banks of the {River Avon,}forming pockets of habitation in the curves of the River's meandering. Surrounding this patchwork are the gentle slopes of the chalk hills, tenanted by local farmers. The Avon provides a source of pleasure, footpaths and bridleways attract the walker and the rider and the sound of make-believe battles echo through the air.
